title: IRC Archive for channel #xwiki on 07 July 2014 - XWiki
content:
<teekay> has joined #xwiki  
04:54 <polx> has joined #xwiki  
05:09 <polx> has quit  
06:49 <mflorea> has joined #xwiki  
07:10 <msmeria> has joined #xwiki  
07:15 <teekay> Hi, is there a place to download older versions of extensions? I am looking for the ldap admin xar package for 5.4.4 and i'm unsure if 5.4.5 will work correctly  
07:45 <exekewtable> has joined #xwiki  
07:58 <gdelhumeau> has joined #xwiki  
08:05 <polx> has joined #xwiki  
08:10 <exekewtable> anyone able to help me with these errors in my catalina.out log? https://gist.github.com/anonymous/8a6f60ee24b3ba803e3e  
08:10 <exekewtable> solr breaking on indexing some fields  
08:35 <mflorea> has quit  
09:06 <mflorea> has joined #xwiki  
09:06 <woshilapin> has joined #xwiki  
09:07 <polx> has quit  
09:13 <cjd> has joined #xwiki  
09:19 <tmortagne> has joined #xwiki  
09:26 <msmeria1> has joined #xwiki  
09:29 <msmeria> has quit  
09:46 <lucaa> has joined #xwiki  
10:01 <teekay> has quit  
10:40 <Slashman> has joined #xwiki  
10:42 <Pbas> has joined #xwiki  
10:48 <KermitTheFragger> has joined #xwiki  
11:28 <vmassol> has joined #xwiki  
11:28 <vmassol> so today is release day for XWiki 6.1! :)  
11:28 <vmassol> tmortagne: are you ready for releasing today?  
11:28 <vmassol> any blockers?  
11:29 <tmortagne> vmassol: none that I know of but looks like there is failing tests  
11:33 <tmortagne> there is XWIKI-10545 that is still open but it's only about snapshot  
11:37 <vmassol> yes and it should be easy to fix, we need to ping Edy about it  
12:02 <tmortagne> has quit  
12:03 <tmortagne> has joined #xwiki  
12:09 <vmassol> tmortagne: I have a commit I'd like to put in 6.1 for Active Installs. I just need 15 minutes or so  
12:10 <tmortagne> vmassol: you have time anyway, platform is building  
12:10 <Lyes1> has joined #xwiki  
12:27 <Enygma`> has joined #xwiki  
12:28 <vmassol> tmortagne: done  
12:32 <evalica> has joined #xwiki  
12:37 <tmortagne> vmassol: looks like you have a failing test  
12:38 <vmassol> weird, I builtactiveinstalls locally  
12:38 <vmassol> strange the error message is not the same  
12:38 <tmortagne> maybe you did nt pulled before  
12:39 <vmassol> fixing  
12:42 <vmassol> should be ok now hopefully  
12:43 <tmortagne> guys I created the 6.1 release note by combining the other 6.1\* RN, please look at it and maybe remove things that don't make sense at this level to move Misc stuff in real sections if you feel there is enough  
13:09 <vmassol> thanks tmortagne, checking  
13:09 <vmassol> gdelhumeau: there's a pb in the flamingo section  
13:10 <vmassol> "The Annotations enabler is now located in the "More Actions" menu:"  
13:10 <vmassol> the screenshot is wrong  
13:10 <vmassol> since the annotations button is now in the More Actions menu  
13:20 <cjd> hmm it seems that FS attachments on 5.2.1 loses data when you delete a document :S  
13:24 <cjd> cannot reproduce with 6.0-rc1  
13:27 <gdelhumeau> vmassol: done  
13:42 <vmassol> gdelhumeau: I still see the annotations button on http://www.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/download/ReleaseNotes/ReleaseNotesXWiki61RC1/flamingo-annotations.png  
13:43 <gdelhumeau> let me fix that  
13:52 <gdelhumeau> I have a big stacktrace when I start XWiki (stable-6.1.x and master)  
13:52 <gdelhumeau> at org.xwiki.component.embed.EmbeddableComponentManager.createInstance(EmbeddableComponentManager.java:312) ~[xwiki-commons-component-default-6.1-SNAPSHOT.jar:na]  
13:52 <gdelhumeau> at org.xwiki.component.embed.EmbeddableComponentManager.getInstance(EmbeddableComponentManager.java:160) ~[xwiki-commons-component-default-6.1-SNAPSHOT.jar:na]  
13:57 <gdelhumeau> should be good now  
13:59 <vmassol> sounds good gdelhumeau, thanks  
14:03 <Slashman> has quit  
14:03 <Slashman> has joined #xwiki  
14:08 <cjd> has quit  
14:12 <cjd> has joined #xwiki  
14:13 <D-Spair> has quit  
14:30 <grimeton> has quit  
14:30 <grimeton> has joined #xwiki  
14:36 <ClemensR> has joined #xwiki  
14:37 <tmortagne> any change in 6.1 related to tags ? looks like all tags related test are broken  
14:38 <tmortagne> I never saw them failing before so they don't seems to be flickering tests  
14:43 <tmortagne> there is something constantly producing ghost jetty/hsqldb instance on agent 3-3  
14:44 <tmortagne> I have to kill one several times a week  
14:44 <cjd> how does the test runner shut it down?  
14:45 <tmortagne> the process is a children of the test runner process so it should not stay alive without it  
14:47 <cjd> mmm not in my experience  
14:47 <cjd> you really have to ask it to shutdown, and then kill -TERM it, then wait a few seconds then kill-9 it  
14:54 <gdelhumeau> If I beleive  the tests reported by Jenkins, xwiki-enterprise-test-ui is broken since I have made some changes in Flamingo  
14:55 <gdelhumeau> But I do not figure out how it could be related, since Flamingo is not enabled by default  
14:56 <gdelhumeau> Actually if fails since the build #3235  
14:57 <gdelhumeau> but at that times it looked like a flickr  
14:58 <gdelhumeau> hmm actually it is related to some changes in xwiki-enterprise-test-pageobjects-6.1.x  
14:59 <gdelhumeau> I did not touch these page objects...  
15:03 <tmortagne> gdelhumeau: xwiki-enterprise-test-pageobjects did not changed since RC1 AFAICS  
15:03 <gdelhumeau> yes  
15:03 <gdelhumeau> actually I don't understand this  
15:04 <tmortagne> the last real change in there seems to be 1 year old  
15:07 <tmortagne> gdelhumeau: why do you say it's flickering, from what I see it started failing at some point and never really stopped  
15:07 <tmortagne> builds like #14 don't really count since they were not really executed  
15:09 <tmortagne> "Started by upstream project xwiki-enterprise-test-pageobjects-6.1.x" does not mean started by a change in xwiki-enterprise-test-pageobjects-6.1.x  
15:09 <tmortagne> it means started because xwiki-enterprise-test-pageobjects has been built  
15:10 <tmortagne> the cause seems to be a change in xwiki-enterprise-6.1.x  
15:10 <gdelhumeau> ok I think I know the problem  
15:10 <tmortagne> according to http://ci.xwiki.org/job/xwiki-enterprise-test-ui-6.1.x/6/  
15:11 <tmortagne> seems related to https://github.com/xwiki/xwiki-enterprise/commit/3d66bb9e1be0648628c2ba1f55a1c54c7cd4f9aa  
15:11 <tmortagne> if we only refer to jenkins  
15:12 <gdelhumeau> got it: https://github.com/xwiki/xwiki-platform/pull/288/files  
15:12 <gdelhumeau> The button to add a tag is selected via the value on the page objects  
15:12 <gdelhumeau> say differently, to looks after a button that haves the value "add" to add a tag  
15:12 <gdelhumeau> But now, the value is "Add"  
15:13 <Enygma`> has quit  
15:13 <gdelhumeau> then it breaks all the following tests  
15:13 <tmortagne> not very nice, the button should have an id or some other more technical identifier than the display  
15:13 <gdelhumeau> indeed  
15:14 <tmortagne> unless we really want to test that the display value is the right one  
15:16 <Enygma`> has joined #xwiki  
15:16 <gdelhumeau> Jenkins never told me that the build has been broken by the pull request  
15:17 <tmortagne> if you trust Jenkins the cause is https://github.com/xwiki/xwiki-enterprise/commit/3d66bb9e1be0648628c2ba1f55a1c54c7cd4f9aa anyway :)  
15:42 <msmeria1> has quit  
15:52 <tmortagne> there is again a ghost on agent 3-3, it's with each build now it seems  
15:52 <tmortagne> did anyone killed a build running on 3-3 ?  
15:52 <tmortagne> please don't do that or then clean the agent if you do  
15:53 <tmortagne> (killed from jenkins UI that is)  
15:53 <msmeria> has joined #xwiki  
16:08 <msmeria> has quit  
16:14 <woshilapin> has quit  
16:16 <tmortagne> yep I confirm after each build of platform 6.1 there is a jetty/hsqldb instance that keeps running  
16:17 <tmortagne> it's near the end  
16:19 <tmortagne> seems to be xwiki-platform-core/xwiki-platform-wiki/xwiki-platform-wiki-test/xwiki-platform-wiki-test-tests/target/xwiki  
16:19 <tmortagne> at least in that case  
16:20 <tmortagne> a simple kill <pid> works instantly on it so it mean there is an issue in this project that makes not not try to stop it at all  
16:23 <ClemensR> tmortagne: maybe when the test is over the instance is still busy indexing any freshly created test wiki? I got the impression jetty ignored the first attempt to stop it in some cases, but stops successfully the second time  
16:23 <ClemensR> just a wild idea of mine, however ....  
16:25 <tmortagne> has quit  
16:38 <andreeapopescu> has joined #xwiki  
16:39 <vmassol> andreeapopescu: gi  
16:39 <vmassol> hi  
16:39 <vmassol> what does "the highest version of XWiki" means on http://design.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Proposal/ExtensionStatus ?  
16:39 <andreeapopescu> vamassol: hi  
16:39 <vmassol> could you make it more clear what it's about?  
16:39 <andreeapopescu> vmassol: hi  
16:39 <andreeapopescu> yes, of course  
16:39 <vmassol> highestt version of XWiki the extension has been tested with?  
16:40 <vmassol> highest version of Xwiki the extensions is working with?  
16:40 <andreeapopescu> exactly  
16:40 <vmassol> exactly for which one? ;)  
16:40 <andreeapopescu> I modified in the table  
16:40 <andreeapopescu> yes  
16:40 <vmassol> the table has not been changed  
16:41 <vmassol> it still says "the highest version of xwiki"  
16:41 <vmassol> which doesn't mean much as explained above  
16:41 <andreeapopescu> done  
16:41 <vmassol> so Selenium app for ex  
16:42 <vmassol> doesn't work with 6.1?  
16:42 <vmassol> (first one)  
16:42 <vmassol> since it says 6.0.1  
16:42 <vmassol> are you really sure?  
16:42 <vmassol> I'm quite convinced it would work with 6.1  
16:42 <vmassol> same for a lot of others  
16:43 <andreeapopescu> yeah, but.. when I tested the app.. 6.1 wasn’t  
16:43 <andreeapopescu> the apps\*  
16:43 <vmassol> 6.1M1, 6.1M2, 6.1RC1  
16:43 <vmassol> and when 6.1 is out  
16:43 <vmassol> your table will all be wrong  
16:43 <vmassol> so you cannot do it like this...  
16:43 <vmassol> :)  
16:43 <vmassol> also I think it would be nice to put some text on this page to explain what you're doing  
16:43 <vmassol> it's not clear what 'extension status' means for me  
16:43 <andreeapopescu> ok.. I will add tomorrow  
16:44 <vmassol> and why you need this page vs the status on e.x.o  
16:44 <vmassol> I mean why have this page at all  
16:44 <vmassol> it doesn't seem very useful to me  
16:44 <vmassol> what is useful is to show the status on each extension on e.x.o  
16:44 <andreeapopescu> I write the status on e.x.o, too  
16:45 <andreeapopescu> wrote\*  
16:45 <vmassol> so why duplicate it?  
16:45 <vmassol> with the risk of not being in sync  
16:45 <andreeapopescu> it was informative for me, to see the changes in the future  
16:46 <vmassol> it seems to me  
16:46 <andreeapopescu> but.. if you say it’s not useful, I will delete the column  
16:46 <vmassol> that this list is more like a checklist between manuel and you to test all extensions on e.x.o and make sure you cover them all  
16:46 <vmassol> is that so?  
16:46 <andreeapopescu> yes  
16:46 <vmassol> in this case you don't need 2 columns  
16:47 <vmassol> btw you could keep the other column but best would be to create JIRAs and link them  
16:49 <andreeapopescu> I created jira tickets for apps which have a project  
16:50 <vmassol> andreeapopescu: I don't see a single JIRA link  
16:50 <vmassol> ok you can keep the version column now that I understand it's something temporary for your own needs only  
16:51 <andreeapopescu> ok, thank you  
16:52 <vmassol> would still be nice to link to jiras  
16:52 <vmassol> using the jira macro  
16:52 <vmassol> (enum style)  
16:52 <vmassol> and create the jira issues  
16:52 <andreeapopescu> ok, I will put them tomorrow  
16:52 <vmassol> if you don't have a project ping us  
16:52 <andreeapopescu> Ok, then  
16:52 <andreeapopescu> I will do  
16:53 <vmassol> for the jira macro usage, see http://extensions.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Extension/JIRA+Macro#HExamples  
16:53 <vmassol> (see enum)  
16:53 <andreeapopescu> a lot of extensions from that list don’t hava jira projects, but I will check  
16:53 <vmassol> the advantage is that we get to see the status of the jira just by looking at the table  
16:54 <vmassol> (enum or list, as you wish)  
16:54 <vmassol> thanks!  
16:54 <andreeapopescu> thank you, too  
17:02 <ClemensR> btw, just got a suggestion from one of our users that sending him a watchlist mail with his updated watchist every time he edits something is not very informative ;)  
17:03 <ClemensR> no idea how to prevent that except of disabling auto-watching at all  
17:08 <vmassol> indeed we should probably exclude ones' changes from the algorithm to decide to send the mail  
17:08 <vmassol> (ClemensR)  
17:08 <vmassol> a jira would be nice to remember this  
17:09 <lucaa1> has joined #xwiki  
17:09 <ClemensR> will add one, first want to answer mail of that guy ;)  
17:09 <vmassol> k  
17:11 <lucaa> has quit  
17:23 <andreeapopescu> has left #xwiki  
17:41 <ClemensR> done as XWIKI-10612  
18:08 <gdelhumeau> has quit  
18:13 <vmassol> thanks
